body:
# TAR archive reader for Crystal

This shard makes you to read the TAR archive files(POSIX ustar format and some functions in GNUTAR fomat).

No external library needed. This is written in pure Crystal.

In this version, following entry types are supported:

- Regular file (typeflag: `'\0'` or `'0'`)
- Hardlink (typeflag: `'1'`)
- Symlink (typeflag: `'2'`)
- Directory (typeflag: `'5'`)
- PAX data (typeflag: `'x'`) (**mtime**, **path**, **linkpath**, **uid**, **gid**)
- GNU long path name (typeflag: `'L'`)
- GNU long link name (typeflag: `'K'`)

Other entry type will be extract as a regular file.

Supports gzipped tar archive file.

## Installation

Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  tarball:
    github: arcage/tarball.cr
```

Then, run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "tarball"

# Extracts all files in "archive.tar" to under the "data" directory.
Tarball.extract_all("archive.tar", "data")

Tarball.open("archive.tar") do |tar|

  # list of included file system objects.
  tar.filenames
  #=> ["dir/", "dir/file_name.txt", "dir/image.png"]

  # extract specific file to specific path.
  tar.extract_file("dir/file_name.txt", "other_name.txt")

  # write content data to IO object.
  tar.write_content("dir/file_name.txt", STDOUT)
end

# open gzipped tar archive
Tarball.open_gz("archive.tar.gz") do |tar|
  # ...
end
```

## API Documents

- [http://www.denchu.org/tarball.cr/](http://www.denchu.org/tarball.cr/)

## Contributors

- [ʕ·ᴥ·ʔAKJ](https://github.com/arcage) - creator and maintainer

types.name: Tarball
types.doc:
```crystal
require "tarball"

# Extracts all files in "archive.tar" to under the "data" directory.
Tarball.extract_all("archive.tar", "data")
```

class_methods.name: extract_all
class_methods.doc: Extracts all file system objects in the tar archive file.
class_methods.summary: Extracts all file system objects in the tar archive file.

class_methods.name: open
class_methods.doc: Opens tar archive file and yields given block.
class_methods.summary: Opens tar archive file and yields given block.

class_methods.name: open_gz
class_methods.doc: Opens gzipped tar archive file and yields given block.
class_methods.summary: Opens gzipped tar archive file and yields given block.

instance_methods.doc: Returns entity from filename.

def.body:
begin
  @entities[filename]
rescue KeyError
  raise(ArchiveError.new("File not found in archive. '#{filename}'"))
end

instance_methods.doc: Returns entity from filename.

def.name: close
def.body:
if closed?
  return
end
if @io.closed?
else
  @io.close
end
@closed = true

instance_methods.name: entities
instance_methods.doc: Returns list of entities in archive.

instance_methods.name: extract_all
instance_methods.doc: Extract all files to under the `dir`

instance_methods.name: extract_file
instance_methods.doc:
Extracts a file to specific path.

If `path` isn't given, default name is used.

instance_methods.name: filenames
instance_methods.doc: Returns list of included filenames.

instance_methods.name: format
instance_methods.doc: Returns file format(`Tarball::Archive::Format`) of this archive

instance_methods.name: write_content
instance_methods.doc: Write content of a file to IO.
instance_methods.summary: Write content of a file to IO.

types.name: Entity
types.doc:
File system objects(regular files, directries or links) in the tar archive.

`Tarball::Entity` object must contain an entity body entry with one of following entry types:

- `Tarball::Entry::Type::FILE` (Regular file)
- `Tarball::Entry::Type::HARDLINK` (Hardlink)
- `Tarball::Entry::Type::SYMLINK` (Symlink)
- `Tarball::Entry::Type::DIRECTORY` (Directory)

It can contain one each of `Tarball::Entry::Type::LONGNAME` (GNUTAR long name) entry, a `Tarball::Entry::Type::LONGNAME` (GNUTAR long linkname) entry, `Tarball::Entry::Type::PAXDATA` (PAX header) entry.
types.summary: File system objects(regular files, directries or links) in the tar archive.

def.body:
if self.type == other.type
  self.name <=> other.name
else
  self.type <=> other.type
end

instance_methods.name: add_entry
instance_methods.doc: Adds tar file entry to this entity.
instance_methods.summary: Adds tar file entry to this entity.

def.name: add_entry
def.body:
case entry.type
when .longname?
  set_long_name(entry)
when .longlinkname?
  set_long_linkname(entry)
when .paxdata?
  set_pax_data(entry)
else
  set_entity_body(entry)
end
self

instance_methods.name: content
instance_methods.doc: Writes content data of the entity to IO.
instance_methods.summary: Writes content data of the entity to IO.

instance_methods.name: directory?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` when self is a directory.

instance_methods.name: file?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` when self is a regular file.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true when self is a regular file.

instance_methods.name: gid
instance_methods.doc: Returns owner group id of this entity.
instance_methods.summary: Returns owner group id of this entity.

instance_methods.name: hardlink?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` when self is a hardlink.

instance_methods.name: has_body?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` when entity body has been set.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true when entity body has been set.

instance_methods.name: has_long_linkname?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` when entity body has been set.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true when entity body has been set.

instance_methods.name: has_long_name?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` when entity body has been set.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true when entity body has been set.

instance_methods.name: linkname
instance_methods.doc:
Returns file or directory name that this entity links to.

`linkname` is only used when the entity body is `Entry::Type::HARDLINK` or `Entry::Type::SYMLINK`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns file or directory name that this entity links to.

def.name: linkname
def.body:
over_ride = if body.format.posix?
  @pax_data["linkpath"]?
else
  if body.format.gnutar?
    @long_linkname
  else
    nil
  end
end
over_ride || body.header.linkname

instance_methods.name: mtime
instance_methods.doc: Returns last modified timestamp of this entity.
instance_methods.summary: Returns last modified timestamp of this entity.

def.name: mtime
def.body:
over_ride = body.format.posix? ? @pax_data["mtime"]?.try do |mtime|
  Time.unix(mtime.to_f.to_i)
end : nil
over_ride || body.header.mtime

instance_methods.name: name
instance_methods.doc: Returns file or directory name of this entity.
instance_methods.summary: Returns file or directory name of this entity.

def.name: name
def.body:
over_ride = if body.format.posix?
  @pax_data["path"]?
else
  if body.format.gnutar?
    @long_name
  else
    nil
  end
end
over_ride || String.build do |str|
  if body.header.posix? && (!body.header.prefix.empty?)
    (str << body.header.prefix) << '/'
  end
  str << body.header.name
end

instance_methods.name: symlink?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` when self is a symlink.

instance_methods.name: uid
instance_methods.doc: Returns owner user id of this entity.
instance_methods.summary: Returns owner user id of this entity.

instance_methods.name: write_content
instance_methods.doc: Writes content data to IO.

instance_methods.name: content_pos
instance_methods.doc: Returns offset of content data.

instance_methods.name: format
instance_methods.doc: Returns entry format.

instance_methods.name: header
instance_methods.doc: Returns `Tarball::Header` object of this entiry

instance_methods.name: next_entry_pos
instance_methods.doc: Returns offset of next entry

instance_methods.name: pax_data
instance_methods.doc:
Returns PAX data.

When self is not a `Tarball::Entry::Type::PAXDATA`

def.name: pax_data
def.body:
if type.paxdata?
else
  raise(EntryError.new("Not a PAXHEADER entry"))
end
pos = @io.pos
buffer = IO::Memory.new(@header.size)
write_content(buffer)
buffer.rewind
Paxdata.parse(buffer)

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Returns entry type.

instance_methods.name: write_content
instance_methods.doc: Writes content data to IO.

def.name: write_content
def.body:
remains = @header.size
@io.pos = content_pos
loop do
  bytes = Tarball.read_block(@io)
  if remains >= BLOCK_SIZE
    io.write(bytes)
  else
    io.write(bytes[0, remains])
    break
  end
  remains = remains - BLOCK_SIZE
end
nil

types.name: Header
types.doc: Header object of entries included in tar file.
types.summary: Header object of entries included in tar file.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates `Tarball::Header` object from byte data.

`data` must be 512 bytes.

instance_methods.name: atime
instance_methods.doc: Returns **atime** field in this header.(GNUTAR format)

instance_methods.name: checksum
instance_methods.doc: Returns **checksum** field in this header.

instance_methods.name: content_blocks
instance_methods.doc: Returns how many blocks exist for content data.
instance_methods.summary: Returns how many blocks exist for content data.

instance_methods.name: ctime
instance_methods.doc: Returns **ctime** field in this header.(GNUTAR format)

instance_methods.name: devmajor
instance_methods.doc: Returns **devmajor** field in this header.(USTAR format)

instance_methods.name: devminor
instance_methods.doc: Returns **devminor** field in this header.(USTAR format)

instance_methods.name: format
instance_methods.doc: Returns entry format.

def.name: format
def.body:
if posix?
  Archive::Format::POSIX
else
  if gnutar?
    Archive::Format::GNUTAR
  else
    Archive::Format::OLD
  end
end

instance_methods.name: gid
instance_methods.doc: Returns **gid** field in this header.

instance_methods.name: gname
instance_methods.doc: Returns **gname** field in this header.(USTAR format)

instance_methods.name: gnutar?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` when self is GNUTAR format.

instance_methods.name: isextended
instance_methods.doc: Returns **isextended** field in this header. (GNUTAR format)

def.name: isextended
def.body:
if gnutar?
else
  HeaderError.new("isextended field can be used only in GNU tar format")
end
@isextended || (@isextended = as_bool(@data[482]))

instance_methods.name: version
instance_methods.doc: Returns **version** field in this header.(USTAR format)

def.name: number_field
string_field
time_field
